item.title: Receive messages
item.description: The project uses Webhooks to send the messages and events from WhatsApp to your application. Webhooks are a way for two different applications to communicate with each other in real-time. When a certain event happens in one application, it sends a message to another application through a webhook URL. The receiving application can then take action based on the information received. To receive incoming messages with webhooks, you first need to set up a webhook URL in your application and pass it to WHATSAPP_HOOK_URL environment variable.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: You can configure WhatsApp HTTP API behaviour via environment variables, by adding -e WHATSAPP_VARNAME=value at the begging of the command line or by using other options docker run -it -e "WHATSAPP_HOOK_EVENTS=*" -e WHATSAPP_HOOK_URL=https://httpbin.org/post devlikeapro/whatsapp-http-api Environment variables # DEBUG=1 - show debug and verbose logs, set in any value WHATSAPP_API_PORT=3000 - listen port for HTTP server (default: 3000) WHATSAPP_API_HOSTNAME=localhost - Hostname for HTTP server (default: localhost) WHATSAPP_API_KEY=mysecret - protect the api with a secret code.
